Package progetto.network

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    IEnforce
    This is the class that must be extended to add a functionality it's up to the implemented transport mechanism tu ensure that it can be transported.
    INetworkClient
    This is the interface that must be implemented by a message transport layer to allow ClientConnection to behave correctly
    INetworkClientFactory  
    INetworkHandler
    The server side implementation of a message transport layer must implement this interface.
    INetworkModule  
    INetworkModuleFactory  
    IRoomRequest
    This is the class that must be extended to add a functionality it's up to the implemented transport mechanism tu ensure that it can be transported.
    ISync
    This interface is used to connect the network to whatever we want to keep synchronized across the net.
    ISyncFactory
    Class provided to the server to be able to spawn a synch object every time it's needed.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractINetowrkClientTest  
    AbstractMessageExchangeTest  
    AbstractNetworkTest  
    AbstractNetworkTestStub  
    AbstractStandardTest  
    AbstractSynchronizationTest  
    ClientConnection
    Client connection is the object encapsulating the the INetworkClient implementations that provide to the client all the method needed to communicate with the server.
    NetworkServer
    A network server is the class that handles the entire state of the network on the server
    NetworkSettings  
    Player
    A Player is a object holding the in room info about a player.
    PlayerView
    A player view is the collection of relevant information that regards a player.
    Room
    The extension of Abstract room that is able to keep the sync object synchronized.
    RoomView  
    ServerState
    This class holds all the information at room level that are need to the server.
    ServerStateView
    A representation of the server state that can be sent across the network.
    SyncFactoryStub  
    SyncStub  
    TestEsempio
